educational_objective: Diagnose metastatic cancer spinal cord compression.
question_text: A 54-year-old man is evaluated for back pain and bilateral leg weakness.An MRI of the spine is shown.
question_stem: Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
critique: The most likely diagnosis is spinal cord compression caused by metastatic cancer (Option C). The MRI of the spine shows metastatic cancer with collapse of the vertebral body and compression of the spinal cord from the posteriorly displaced bony fragments (arrow). High-dose systemic glucocorticoids should be administered immediately, and emergent neurosurgical consultation is indicated.
